original: Beckman, Gustaf Erik Alexander, kapten, Norrköping, f. 13/12/79 i Gun-nilbo, Västmanl. 1., av bruksäg. Gustaf B. o. Elin Holmberg. G. 10 m. frih :an Ebba Lagerbielke. Barn: Marit f. 18. — Mog:ex. i StWm 99, off:-ex. 01. Språkstud. i Tyskl. 02, Frankr. 05-06 o. Engl. 09-10. Und:löjtn. v. Livreg. gren. 01, löjtn. 06, avsk. 09, kapt. i res. 16. Anst. i Engl. 09-10, v. verkst. dir. i H. Unér A-B i Norrköp. 11-31, däreft. verkst. dir. där. Fd. led. av drätselkamm., styr. f. komm. affärsverken o. styr. f. Norrköp. Sparbank. Franisk konsuferag. sed. 18. Led. av Norrköp. automobil- o. flygkl. Hobbies: jakt o. fiske. RNO, RVO, OffRumKrO, RFrHL, OffFrdeFIp.
translated: Beckman, Gustaf Erik Alexander, captain, Norrköping, born December 13th, 1879 in Gunnilbo, Västmanland, Sweden, son of industrialist Gustaf B. and Elin Holmberg. Married in 1910 to Baroness Ebba Lagerbielke. Children: Marit born in 1918. Graduated from military academy in Stockholm in 1899 and officer's academy in 1901. Studied languages in Germany in 1902, France from 1905-1906, and England from 1909-1910. Served as lieutenant in the Life Regiment Grenadiers from 1901-1906, retired as captain in 1916. Employed in England from 1909-1910 and as executive director at H. Unér A-B in Norrköping from 1911-1931, thereafter as managing director there. Former member of the city council, board member of the municipal utilities and board member of Norrköping Savings Bank. French consul since 1918. Member of Norrköping Automobile and Aviation Club. Hobbies include hunting and fishing. Awarded with the Order of the North Star, Order of Vasa, Officer of the Order of the Sword, French Legion of Honor, Officer of the French National Order of Merit.

structured.name: Gustaf Erik Alexander Beckman

Officer of the French National Order of Merit
